Package com.amonson.task_manager

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amonson.task_manager.Task
  • public class Task
extends java.lang.Object
    A Task that can be run as a process or as an isolated thread.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Task.Type
      Possible types of task execution (Process=Default or Thread).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Execute the task either on a Thread or Process.
      java.lang.Throwable getException()
      Get a exception if the Thread.start() or ProcessBuilder.start() threw an exception.

      Get a exception if the Thread.start() or ProcessBuilder.start() threw an exception.

      Get the return code from the application task.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public static Task execute​(java.lang.Class<?> mainClass,
                           java.lang.String[] args,
                           Task.Type type,
                           java.lang.Object userData)
        Execute the task either on a Thread or Process. This constructs a running Task.
        Parameters:
        mainClass - The Class object ofthe class containing the "public static void main(String[] args)".
        args - The arguments to pass to the application.
        type - The type of execution (either Thread or Process).
        userData - Arbitrary user data object stored in the Task object. This is not passed to the thread/process.
        Returns:
        The Task object of the running task.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Test if the Task is running.
        Returns:
        true if the Task is still running, false if the Task has stopped.

      • stopRunning

        public void stopRunning()
        Stops the Task. Uses .destroy() on a process or .interrupt() on a thread.

      • waitForCompletion

        public boolean waitForCompletion()
        Block until the Task stops.
        Returns:
        true if the wait exits normally (stopped) or false if it did not stop normally.

      • waitForCompletion

        public boolean waitForCompletion​(long milliSeconds)
        Block until stopped or a timeout expires.
        Parameters:
        milliSeconds - The milliseconds to wait for stopping.
        Returns:
        true if the Task stopped in less than the timeout, false otherwise.

      • getResult

        public int getResult()
        Get the return code from the application task. This will block and wait if not already stopped.
        Returns:
        An integer return code. For a process this is the code returned to the shell.

      • getResult

        public int getResult​(long milliSeconds)
        Get the return code from the application task. This will block and wait if not already stopped until a timeout in ms.
        Parameters:
        milliSeconds - The milliseconds to wait for completion.
        Returns:
        An integer return code. For a process this is the code returned to the shell. This will be Integer.MIN_VALUE if the timeout expires.

      • getUserData

        public java.lang.Object getUserData()
        Retrieve the user data supplied in execute().
        Returns:
        The data passed by the user and stored in the Task.

      • getException

        public java.lang.Throwable getException()
        Get a exception if the Thread.start() or ProcessBuilder.start() threw an exception. Will wait for completion.
        Returns:
        The Throwable thrown or null if no exception was thrown.

      • getException

        public java.lang.Throwable getException​(long milliSeconds)
        Get a exception if the Thread.start() or ProcessBuilder.start() threw an exception. Will wait for completion.
        Parameters:
        milliSeconds - The timeout in ms to wait for completion.
        Returns:
        The Throwable thrown or null if not exception or the timeout expired.
